org.odk.collect.android.location.client

Class GoogleFusedLocationClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odk.collect.android.location.client.GoogleFusedLocationClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.common.api.internal.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.internal.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener, LocationClient

    public class GoogleFusedLocationClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener
    An implementation of LocationClient that uses Google Play Services to retrieve the User's location.

    Should be used whenever there Google Play Services is present. In general, use LocationClientProvider to retrieve a configured LocationClient.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.odk.collect.android.location.client.LocationClient

        LocationClient.LocationClientListener, LocationClient.Priority

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks

        CAUSE_NETWORK_LOST, CAUSE_SERVICE_DISCONNECTED

      • GoogleFusedLocationClient

        public GoogleFusedLocationClient(@NonNull
                                 android.app.Application application)
        Constructs a new GoogleFusedLocationClient with the provided Context.

        This Constructor should be used normally.

        Parameters:
        application - The application. Used as the Context for building the GoogleApiClient because it doesn't release context.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Prepares the LocationClient for use. This method must be called prior to LocationClient.requestLocationUpdates(LocationListener) or LocationClient.getLastLocation().
        Specified by:
        start in interface LocationClient

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Stops the LocationClient, ending any current connections and allowing resources to be reclaimed.

        Implementations should call LocationClient.stopLocationUpdates() if they have been previously requested.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface LocationClient

      • requestLocationUpdates

                                   com.google.android.gms.location.LocationListener locationListener)
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Begins requesting Location updates with the provided LocationListener
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        locationListener - The LocationListener to pass location updates to.

      • stopLocationUpdates

        public void stopLocationUpdates()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Ends Location updates for the previously provided LocationListener. Implementations should call this from within LocationClient.stop().
        Specified by:
        stopLocationUpdates in interface LocationClient

      • getLastLocation

        public android.location.Location getLastLocation()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Retrieves the most recent known Location, or null if none is available. This method may block if start was not called before hand.
        Specified by:
        getLastLocation in interface LocationClient
        Returns:
        The most recent Location.

      • canSetUpdateIntervals

        public boolean canSetUpdateIntervals()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Provides a way to tell if the underlying LocationClient allows the updateInterval to be set. Currently only the GoogleFusedLocationClient can handle updateInterval changes.
        Specified by:
        canSetUpdateIntervals in interface LocationClient
        Returns:
        Whether or the LocationClient's updateInterval can be set.

      • setUpdateIntervals

        public void setUpdateIntervals(long updateInterval,
                               long fastestUpdateInterval)
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Sets the LocationClient's updateInterval (how often we would like updates) and fastestUpdateInterval (for throttling updates that come at a faster interval).

        Implementations that don't offer this feature should do nothing here.

        Specified by:
        setUpdateIntervals in interface LocationClient
        Parameters:
        updateInterval - How often we would like updates from the LocationClient (inexact).
        fastestUpdateInterval - The minimum interval between updates (exact).

      • resetUpdateIntervals

        public void resetUpdateIntervals()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Resets the LocationClient's updateInterval and fastestUpdateInterval.

        Implementations that don't offer this feature should do nothing here.

        Specified by:
        resetUpdateIntervals in interface LocationClient

      • isLocationAvailable

        public final boolean isLocationAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Provides a way to tell if the LocationClient can access the User's Location based on the current Priority settings. Must be called after Location updates have been requested.
        Specified by:

      • getProvider

        protected java.lang.String getProvider()

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(@NonNull
                        LocationClient.Priority priority)
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Sets the LocationClient's LocationClient.Priority which will be used to determine which Provider (GPS, Network, etc.) will be used to retrieve the User's location.

        If the LocationClient is already receiving updates, the new Priority will not take effect until the next time Location updates are requested.

        Specified by:
        setPriority in interface LocationClient
        Parameters:
        priority - The new Priorty.

      • setListener

        public void setListener(@Nullable
                        LocationClient.LocationClientListener locationClientListener)
        Description copied from interface: LocationClient
        Sets the LocationClient.LocationClientListener which will receive status updates for the LocationClient. The LocationClient should hold only a WeakReference to the listener so that it does not cause a memory leak.
        Specified by:
        setListener in interface LocationClient
        Parameters:
        locationClientListener - The new LocationClient.LocationClientListener.

        protected LocationClient.LocationClientListener getListener()
